title: Motsi Mabuse and Alfonso Ribeiro in tears after Will Bayley's emotional routine

Strictly Come Dancing has finished its fifth week, and it saw an absolute tearjerker of a performance.

Paralympian Will Bayley, who was born with Arthrogryposis Multiplex Congenita or AMC (curvature of the limbs), took to the floor with a moving routine danced to Lukas Graham's hit Seven Years.

This wasn't before they played a short clip showing Will and pro partner Janette Manrara visiting Great Ormond Street Hospital, which cares for sick children.

Will had operations there as a kid for his condition, and he gave Janette a tour round the amazing institution.

In the clip, he also told his story of being diagnosed with non-hodgkin lynphoma aged seven.

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

After they'd danced, co-host Tess Daly turned to Alfonso for his feedback, who's eyes were glistening with tears.

The Fresh Prince of Bel Air star said: "You gave me chills."

The camera then panned to Motsi, who was lost for words and even more teary eyed amid her emotions. Will rushed over and gave her a hug for comfort.

(Image: BBC)

Shirley looked touched too, but managed: "This is you, you came out here and shared your journey. I'm sure that every child in every children's hospital is looking at that today and has discovered that no matter what you put your mind to you can do it under extreme circumstances.

"You're inspiring. You give the whole nation hope."

The rest of the night saw some absolute showstoppers from the likes of Saffron and AJ, Karim and Amy and, unsurprisingly, Kelvin and Oti.

Saffron and AJ triumphed this week, sitting at the top of the leader board with an unbelievable 38 points.

They wowed the judge with their Foxtrot set to Frank Sinatra, and earned Alfonso's only 10 out of 10 for the whole night.
description: Motsi and guest judge Alfonso were reduced to tears after Will and partner Janette Manrara visited Great Ormond Street Hospital before hitting the floor
